snippet: After Moscow instituted a brief cease-fire, many said leaving the besieged Syrian city could still be more dangerous than staying and exposing themselves to continued airstrikes....
abstract: Residents of Aleppo, Syria, doubt Russia will honor its recent declaration of cease-fire, ostensibly to deliver humanitarian aid guarantee safe passage for civilians to leave; choose perils of constant bombardment over uncertainty of flight from their homes.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, Maher Samaan from Paris, and Ivan Nechepurenko and Sophia Kishkovsky from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: After Moscow instituted a brief cease-fire, many said leaving the besieged Syrian city could still be more dangerous than staying and exposing themselves to continued airstrikes.

headline.main: Wary of Russian Guarantees, Residents Stay Put in War-Torn Aleppo
headline.print_headline: Wary of Russian Guarantees, Residents Are Staying Put in Aleppo
